The upper half of B. Street (heading towards W. Broadway) is constantly dirty.  For the life of me I can't figure out why the dumpsters in the housing developments aren't enclosed so that the homeless and others can't rifle through them and leave trash everywhere.  As of late it only seems to have gotten worse.  Can't these be enclosed?
Pothole in right lane on 1A, 6 inches deep. Was fixed a few weeks ago but has come back already. Needs a better patch job

Crosswalk needed across Freeman St. on Charles St.  This area is located near school, community center, T station, etc, but many cars speed down 1-way Freeman St.  I have seen many near-accidents with children here.

summary: Crosswalks and Lane Markings Need Repainting
description: The crosswalks are heavily faded and the lane markings almost completely gone on the Haymarket square loop buses and traffic swing around to head North.

summary: Excessive noise- semi trucks and cars blasting music drive through
description: Excessive noise- semi trucks and cars blasting music loud enough to wake my children drive through at all hours of the night.  They need to start ticketing cars for noise violations and making it illegal for cars to drive through the neighborhood as shortcut to get to boston. This has been occurring for over two years with not a single ticket given out! What do I have to do to get attention for this issue?
the whole road to dedham street needs to be repaved

summary: Lights on pedestrian bridge in Allston were out
description: fixed

40 mph speed limit onto City streets off Mass Pike is too fast

local officials say the state has to resolve this issue!

summary: Excessive speeding/urinationn/Nudity in front of children
description: Cars are speeding at the intersection of Egleston Sq/Atherton St and Washington St.  Intoxicated pedestrians urinating on Egleston Square property and males flashing themselves around children.
Bike lanes that were less than one month old were removed.

summary: Signs need to be put up for no parking on one side of the street.
description: I am referring to the whole avenue.  Cars are always parked on both sides of the street as the street is very narrow. The street was not made for cars parking.  Also Huntington ave is a two way street.

Pothole going south over the neponse bridge(1 lane) no way to really avoid this one with jersey barriers on each side of you. Traffic is bad enough with the construction, the least the city could do is fix this one for commuters.

summary: graffiti on bike/ped sign @ McBride St. entrance to Southwest Corridor Park

description: Silver Honda with Michigan plates and no East Boston parking sticker sitting on street for 3 months.

summary: speeding. no stopping at stop sign.
description: nobody stops at the stop sign on chestnut and child street. too many cars speeding down child st.

summary: speeding and crosswalk on Amory Street by The Brewery
description: Drivers speed up and down Amory St. and completely ignore crosswalk at Southwest Corridor near The Brewery.

summary: stop sign at st. joseph's needed
description: there used to be two stop signs at st. joseph's and at woodman, now only one at woodman remains. often, people do not stop and just cross over, which is pretty dangerous. i'd like to see a stop sign return to st. joseph's at that intersection.

summary: Abandoned and neglected property: Weld American
description: This building has been uninhabited for years, is run down, and is an unfortunate eye sore.  Something needs to be done for the revitalization of our neighborhood.

The block of stores at 4337-4343 Washington St (at Albano st) in Roslindale is showing severe signs of disinvestment. The 4 stores occupy a building that have graffiti filled grates that get pulled down at night, the paint is pealing on the walls, the ripped awning over the now closed liquor store is falling down and the corner looks like one in a 3rd world country. Shame on the tenants and the landlord for not keeping it up and caring about their community. Is not hard to see the lessons learned right down the street in Roslindale Village: take down the grates, remove the grafitti, keep the storefronts clean with appealing signs and customers will come. How come these business people dont get it?

Harrison street is becoming just way too noisy with people installing car alarms that go on and off all day/night . The city has to take measure against useless noises . What the point of an alarm anyway if it's on for nothing ??!!

summary: No sidewalk;pedestrians walk in the street
description: The parking lot next to Chau Chau city overflows into the street so there is no place for pedestrians to walk. If pedestrians try to walk in the parking lot, they are met with water-filled holes, extremely uneven and unsafe surfaces. Not sure why they are allowed to not have a sidewalk, when another parking lot up Essex Street put a sidewalk at the end of their lots. It's not safe.

summary: Dangerous sidewalk, and not wheelchair friendly
description: The sidewalk that spans the length of Chau Chau city has NO ramp on one side, and the curb is 8-10 inches high. The other end of the sidewalk has a ramp, so someone in a wheelchair can get stuck when they go the length of it and have no ramp on the other side, and a very very high curb to boot.

The street is only wide enough for 1 car to pass but it is a two-way street.  Frequently drivers get into violent arguments and block traffic because neither can pass.  This should be turned into a one-way street from Percival to Mt Ida.
double parking all along Center Street (and, of course, in the entire City of Boston) with serious traffic jams. Ignored by Police all the time and everywhere.

summary: water leaking out of the center of the street

Dangerous Intersection why is there no stop sign at the intersection of Lawn St. and Heath St. people fly through this intersection all the time, resulting in at least one crash a week. Please put in  a stop sign!
description:
Reported from my mobile device
http://m.seeclickfix.com
TV left on street for over 4 weeks now.  Tenants moved out of apt several week ago.

summary: Need lane markers at intersection of laGrange and centre Street
description: The repaved laGrange St and remarked it but forgot to put the left turn and right-turn-straightahead arrows on the road. This causes real havoc at the intersection
This area is disgusting and the trash around this store needs to be cleaned.  The owners need to take some responsibility for keeping this area cleaned.

Nuisance of a neighbor is trying to park his Sprinter van illegally at 20 Grimes St. 
The police have come 2 times and told him not to park there.
Owner of the property has told hime not to park there.
Tennants have had this problem since move in day September 1st.
Property management has told him he cannot park there.
What else can be done to stop this guy?
Numerous tires slashed in middle of the night at this location.  Underage drinking taking place.  Police patrols needed.

All day long, cars race from the stop sign at the intersection of Stedman St down Rossmore Rd. Kids, dogs, bike riders and pedestrians fear crossing the street or opening the door to their cars because of this. There is a new playground on the corner of Stedman/Rossmore! "Slow" signs DO NOT work. PLEASE please install two speed bumps on the section of Rossmore Rd between Stedman and Washington. Similar to other streets in JP that have speed bumps. A child will be killed some day!

summary: Warren St. and Comm Ave. Light
description: This light going outbound lets only 4 (or fewer) cars pass through. Generally you sit through 2 or 3 lights before making through intersection.
The side walk is in need of repair. It has deep holes & cracks.
Can someone turn on the street lights on the overpass on Cambridge Street to Storrow Drive by the Doubletree Hotel? Why are they not on?
I have received numerous expired meter fines for my car which clearly has my handicapped placard displayed on my rearview mirror.

It would be very helpful to have trash bins placed on K Street (especially closest to East Broadway, but also further down the street near Joseph's Bakery).  I noticed that there are solar trash bins down near M Street Beach that seem to work very well at controlling litter being thrown on the sidewalk.   It would be great if we could keep our streets litter free!!!

summary: Stop Sign Needed On Moraine Street @ Ashcroft Street
description: Cars speeding down Moraine St towards and from the Jamaicaway do not pay attention to the fact that cars may be enterinf Moraine St from Ashcroft St.  It is very hard to see up and down Moraine St when entering from Ashcroft and there have been several near-collisions lately.  Be carful!

Is in the middle lane, right at the light just either next to the Boston globe or just after it. But right at the light. Makes people in the middle lane move over quickly to get out of the way. Please fix this soon!

Washington St. between Dudley Sq and Egleston Sq.
Traffic lights could be timed better, also left turn lanes at Dale Street. Sync lights at interseciton of post office (Malcolm X Blvd and Shawmut Ave) to allow traffic to take turns. See Mass Ave between Washington St and the city of Cambridge for an example.
Cars parking the wrong way on the street,they can not even see when pulling out of the spot.

summary: Left turn lane no longer marked clearly
description: The left lane of Charlesgate East between the two directions on Commonwealth Ave is no longer clearly marked as a turn lane--you can see in the Google hybrid map how the arrow has worn away. Cars go straight in that lane--and three lanes don't fit into two! Very dangerous.
half of the tall lamp lightbulbs are out, mostly on side where playground is

summary: Large deep holes in sidewalk and Driveway 30 Monument Sq and Bartlett Street
description: This item has been reported numerous tines in the past 18 months and has not been corrected.  The holes are very deep and there is a great concern that some will be fall and get injured. Please help in getting this corrected.
Garage roof colapsing  rear porches sinking  widow glass falling out of frames front steps deteriorated.....needs paint..property over grown  hegdes extending over sidewalk
Loud poarties almost every weekend in woarmer months
NEED TRAFFIC LIGHT FOR SCHOOL CHILDREN CROSSING STREET EVERY MORNING
Cien Pie Tire 223 Hancock Street at Pleasant.  This building is covered with graffiti,from the roof line to the foundation.

Often times in the morning, delivery trucks extend from a Northeastern driveway into Hemenway Street completely blocking the traffic.  Because of the stop sign on Hemenway as you approach Forsyth, there is always a line of traffic, making it next to impossible to drive around the delivery trucks.

This is a serious safety concern as emergency vehicles would not be able to safely navigate the street.
Between the train station at Kenmore on the South side and Charles Gate East there are no trash cans. Considering ball games crowds it is a considerable sanitary problem.

summary: cars running red lights--someone is going to die
description:
Every single day I see a car (or cars) running the red light, doing 50, almost hitting folks in the crosswalks.  Someone is going to die.
A traffic light camera that snaps license plates and sends out $100+ fines might reduce the problem.

Cars that park on the left side of Park Street (between March and Rutledge) cause a significant traffic problem.  Park St. is a heavily travelled road and needs "one side of the street parking."  This problem only becomes worse in the winter with snow.

summary: Broken street lights corner of Corey & VFW
description: At these lights every single light change there is the walk signal.  Even though no one is there.  Every single time.  What a waste of gasoline waiting for the walk signal every single light change.
There is one sign on Laurie Avenue that says: Laurie St. Please correct this at your earliest convenience.  Thank you.

summary: Lots of outside of BMC Dr. Office Garage
description: There are large amounts of trash in the bushes and on the grounds around the E. Brookline St side of the Doctors' Office Building garage. It has been that way for weeks and needs to be cleaned up.
Very deep pothole. Not large in width but very deep.  Difficult to see when driving down street. Looks like a very small sink hole.
Dead tree at the corner of Clarendon and Warren Streets. Severely rotted and will soon fall down on its own without attention

summary: Somebody consistently parks their car overnight in the bike lane, and never gets a ticket.
description: Multiple times a week, for months now, I have seen a small compact car parked IN the bike lane on Washington Street, just south of Ukraine.  The car will be parked there overnight, completely blocking the bike lane, and I have never seen a ticket on the window.  This forces bikers to swerve into the traffic lane to avoid the parked car.

The sidewalk along the train tracks on Washington Street is in complete disrepair, with large sections of broken concrete and patches of asphalt that have just been dumped on the sidewalk.  This is on the block between the MBTA employee parking lot and Ukraine.

summary: Complete lack of maintenance of landscaping along Hyde Park Ave, Ukraine, and parts of Washington Street around Forest Hills Station.
description: The city put in nice, wide granite benches all along Hype Park Ave by Forest Hills Station, but the MBTA has let the bushes grow wild and overtake the whole area.  There is a ton of garbage within the bushes, and they are also home to rats.  The MBTA needs to clean out the garbage and cut back the bushes so the benches can be used as intended.

summary: Pedestrian Nightmare Crossing (worse than by the Pond)
description: The city needs to paint and/or repaint pedestrian crossings at the Morton Street / Arborway / Franklin Park / Forest Hills Cemetary rotary and connecting streets.  This location is a nightmare for pedestrians trying to cross in either direction.  Poor signage, and barely visible cross walk markings, if any.  Cars routinely fly through at high speeds.  How is it that the city spends so much time and attention on the affluent, White side of JP and totally ignores the less affluent side of JP.

summary: Traffic Light instruction sign and enforcement
description: There has been at least one FATALITY at this intersection. Another post shows that 18 people want this fixed already, and that's just the people using this website. People making a left turn from the Northern part of Harvard Ave onto Cambridge street act like they have a protected left turn when they don't. Do you need another death to put up some clear notification preventing people from doing this, and stepping up enforcement?

summary: Blind Turn in Heavy Traffic Area
description: People turning out of Oak Square YMCA can't see far enough down Washington Street (especially when turning left) to turn safely; parked cars block the view. There should be no parking within 2-3 car lengths of this intersection.
Allston St was resurfaced for half of the length from Comm Ave to Brighton Ave. Why hasn't the rest of it been resurfaced?

** THIS WAS FIXEED MONTHS AGO AND I HAVE TRIED TO CLOSE IT AT LEAST TEN TIMES TO NO AVAIL.  THAT'S ALMOST AS ANNOYING AS THE ORIGINAL PROBLEM!!**

There has been a slow leak from the watermain on Metropolitan Ave at the Western corner of Washington Street for MONTHS!  Even worse, they just stripped the road to repave it, and paved RIGHT OVER THE LEAK!!!
Nobody likes techno. Stop blasting it.

The "No Turn on Red" signs have been removed from all of the Mass Ave intersections during construction, creating a hazard to pedestrians by turning cars blocking crosswalks during walk signals and to cyclists "blocking" the right lane during red lights and being honked at by inpatient drivers. These signs need to be restored.

There are about 8 television sets dumped on the sidewalk just before the W. Springfield Street Community Garden.  They are on the sidewalk behind 556 Mass. Ave (these buildings back up onto W. Springfield Street.  The TVs have been there for nearly a week now.
no crosswalks, or just barely painted infront of the carney hospital. the amount of foot and vehicular traffic that cross eachother at this location. suprised someone hasnt been struck by a car.

There are constantly road workers standing around not doing anything, and it seems as if that road project is never going to finish. Furthermore, it doesn't look like a single thing has or will change.

intersection of Boylston, Brookline, and Park has crosswalk at 4 of the 5 roads but not on Brookline southwest of intersection. To get from Brookline Ave to Park Dr one has to either jaywalk across 6 lanes or take a series of 4 crosswalks in a clockwise loop.

summary: Detailing Construction Police are seen on cell phones while working not paying attention~!
description: Construction in Southie continues from the summer and will go on into the Winter. Our Officers are great people but Its incredibly frustrating when they are seen on their cell phones- or chatting it up with their fellow workers and failing to pay attention to drivers-there have been numerous close calls especially with St. brigids Catholic School getting out.. This is OUR tax dollars we are paying them and it'd be nice if they paid attention ALL OF THE TIME
Pothole about 5 inches deep with vertical edges. I hit it with my bike and got a flat and had to replace the tire.

The pedestrian crosswalk from the center of Rutherford to the BHCC side of the street on the way to the T is very dangerous.  There is almost no trace left of the painted crosswalk, and cars barrel through the yield without ever thinking to stop.  I've almost gotten hit there, and I've seen many other pedestrians have to jump back onto the curb to avoid getting creamed by oncoming traffic.  That crossing, at the very least, should have a freshly painted crosswalk and possibly one of those flexible signs that say "stop for peds in crosswalk--its the law."  The crosswalk in the attached pic is no longer visible.

This is a square piece of the road that looks like it was meant to be fixed but hasn't been fixed for nearly a year now. It's in an awkward part of the road that you can't avoid and just makes your car juggle.
PEOPLE DO NOT PICK UP AFTER THERE DOGS ON EMERSON ST            still a problem

summary: Speeding drivers in a residental zone
description: Drivers regularly drive recklessly (speeding and attempting to pass one another) on Fuller St. They use it as a cut-through from Dot Ave to Washington St. There are tons of kids on this street and a footpath from Fuller that leads directly to the Woodrow Wilson Middle School. We need some speedbumps before someone gets hurt!
There is a very dead tree in front of the Aztra Zeneca Hope lodge that's going to come down on the catenary lines, a car or a person!

summary: Sidewalk bricks are loose, causing a hole that's dangerous
description: The bricks that make up the sidewalk are loose and being kicked around, causing an ever wide hole in the sidewalk. There's a hole now that's growing as more bricks are loosened. Someone could trip and this will be especially dicey with snow and ice on the ground.

summary: Unsightly Trash and Debris on MBTA Ashmont Station property
description: The MBTA's fenced in property at Ashmont Station along Huron Path and Huron Circle is full of trash and debris that degrades the immediate neighborhood.  Recently, "No Dumping" signs have been put up on the property fence, but the trash and debris on the MBTA property has not been cleared.  MBTA, please clean up your mess soon!
There is no sign for Harriet Street where Harriet meets Parsons Street.

There are exposed nails sticking out of timber/wood that surounds the swing area.  This is very dangerous!  Many children and adults have tripped and fell.  Also Hobart Park has a water sprinkler and many children go barefoot in the playground.  Please fix ASAP!!!!!

summary: Police do not communicate with the neighborhood
description: Example:  A body was found in Flaherty Park.  What should the public be aware of to help the police.  The issue is that there is an increase in crime and the police need to start a process to empower us to help them.  The body may have been a non-violent issue, but it is a quality of life issue and the police should be in constant communication with us.
Every few weeks old car tires are dumped on Newton St. The dumpers seem to like irony as they generally dump them under on of the signs saying, "No Dumping".

summary: Trash in alley #908 at all times of day and night.
description: Alley is rat infested and disgusting because people dump household trash at all times--not during scheduled pick up times

summary: Fix left turn light from Western Ave onto Soldiers Field
description: The left turn light from Western Ave onto Soldiers Field road has been broken (as in it no longer lights up) for at least three years. You have to take your life in your hands and try to guess when you can turn onto Soldiers Field

The block (West Broadway and F Street) that Pan Asia is located on is filled with trash (beer cans, cigarette buttons, fast food wrappers).   It unfortunate that Pan Asia is not helping out by keeping this area clean.  After all, it is located right in front of their door step.
There is a deep pothole at the top of the River St/Cambridge St exit off Soldier's Field Rd (westbound).

summary: Uneven road surface, multiple pot holes
description: Very dangerous driving in the right lane on the Mass Pike going east just after entering the Prudential tunnel.  Some drivers are swerving to avoid the rough surface/potholes creating hazardous driving conditions.

summary: Wet cat food left outside for all to eat
description: There is an empty lot across the street from several houses where someone leaves out wet cat food on a plate underneath a small table. I understand that the cats eat it but we've seen on several occasions that possums and skunks have been eating it too leaving to several rodent problems in the area, including cats and dogs being sprayed by skunks. I understand that the cats are being taken care of but this uncovered, wet cat food is causing several other problems.

summary: needed: 4-ft no-parking zone on Ayr Rd
description:
Pulling out onto Ayr Rd from the alleyway that runs parallel to Orkney and Beacon (ie directly behind Eagle's Deli, Ace Hardware, Pino's Pizza.) is extremely dangerous--the parked cars on Ayr Rd make it nearly impossible to see oncoming traffic from either direction.

This is particularly true if you are making a right onto Ayr Rd, heading South towards Beacon St.

If a short (3-4 ft) no-parking zone was established on Ayr Rd from the mouth of this alleyway, it would be a tremendous aid to the visibility of drivers pulling out onto this street, and accidents like the one I had a few weeks ago could be avoided!

Thank you for considering this idea.

summary: Please fix pedestrian crossing from the north to south side of Washington
description: The pedestrian crossing control is broken. Thus many pedestrians end up crossing the street without a walking signal. This is a major intersection at Brookline and Washington. The pedestrian crossing the street from W Brookline to E Brookline, across Washington Street from the north side of Washington must end up crossing this busy intersection without a red light to stop the traffic on Washington.

This is an extremely confusing intersection with frequent gridlock, angry drivers, and unclear lane designation. Let's do something here.

http://www.boston.com/realestate/news/articles/2008/06/15/question_of_congestion/?page=full


Also the 39 bus leaves the station northbound and stops immediately on the other side of the street: very wasteful.

Please vote to support the library and let City Hall know that we do not want it to be closed.

http://www.wickedlocal.com/allston/fun/entertainment/books/x863091956/Library-trustees-approve-closing-Brightons-Faneuil-branch-library
At the corner of D Street and Congress Street traffic lights are being covered by tree branch. Trees need to be cut back.

summary: Lack of a crosswalk and warning signs by the Cabot entrance
description:
Cabot Estate Condominiums are home to over 300 people
who cross the 30 feet from the entrance of the complex across Perkins Street to Jamaica Pond. The crossing is hazardous because of the blind curve coming west, the recklessness of some drivers and the lack of a crosswalk and signage. On 9/10/2010 my S.O. was crossing with her dog, as she does 4 times each day, when she was struck by a distracted driver and sent to the ICU with 8 broken bones and a subdural hematoma. If she were not light and in excellent physical condition, she would have been the fatality which would get attention.

There is absolutely no access to safe pedestrian crossing between our condominium at 241 Perkins St., Jamaica Plain (Cabot Estate) and Jamaica Pond, which is directly across the street.  We are a community of 161 residences and more than 300 people living in a virtual pedestrian island. Yesterday one of our neighbors was hit a seriously injured while crossing the street.  We have been trying for decades to hear "yes" from someone with the authority to give us a safe way to cross the street. We have heard lots of folks say "no, because....." but it seems illogical that there is no one who can figure out a way to permit folks in our community to safely cross the street.

must stop the double parking in front of PS deli. this goes on all day long as people stop in the middle of the street to get their coffee. they block the right lane to the green arrow to continue on to east broadway. meter maids n police need to do their jobs! this is a huge problem when it takes 10 minutes to get through perkins square.

summary: Desperately need a pedestrian walk/don't walk crossing signal for sidewalk
description: The sidewalk/bike path crosses Cambridge St. here, but there's no pedestrian crossing at all.  No signal, and no good time to try and cross, so people have to guess and run for their lives.  Joggers, walkers, bikers, families, students all have to make a mad dash and hope for the best.

There should be a turn signal at the intersection of Market Street and Washington Street. Traffic is backed up on both streets with people waiting to turn. Plus, it's a safety hazard as people wait until after the light turns red to turn, or jumps the light and turns before the light turns green.
The stop light crossing Foster gets stuck on green for minutes at a time, backing up traffic on Washington Street.
on the arborway in jamaica plain, going northbound, just where the arborway meets the centre street rotary. There's a big pothole in the left hand lane.

There are many oneway streets in my neiborhood and the drivers are not looking both ways. While turning left or right they only look in the direction the trafic. Also, they are texting while driving.  I think if we all had a 211, 411 or a 911 setup to report the time and liscence # it would stop.

Hooker Street intersects with Royal street and there is poor traffic control at this intersection. Also, the parked cars make it difficult for drivers on both streets to see one another. If you are not cautious, you are bound to get into an accident.

summary: (pothole) Storrow Outbound just after Fenway/Kenmore Exit
description: HUGE pothole in the travel lane on Storrow Outbound.  Encountered afternoon of 8/27/10, passed car with flat tire and there were MANY hubcaps on the side of the road.

The cross walk, made up of stone blocks, is uneven and badly damaged. This is a trip hazard and rough on cars. The same stone blocks are used at other points of this intersection without issue. The summer St crossing appears to have been improperly laid.
sdf

summary: Paint curb in Commercial Loading Zone
description: There is a commercial loading zone in front of 501 Boylston St. People are confused by the signs, park their cars here, pay to park in this area, and then proceed get a ticket from the city! If the curb was repainted with the yellow paint that you usually see, people would be less likely to park here.

summary: police writing false tickets in west trenton
description: ireally would like to know why i was written a no seatbelt ticket and no insurance ticket when i was not operating my vehicle

Not only is this intersection busy, but the size and amount of oversized pothole is an example of how the city continues to neglect the safety of our community.  This road has been in this deplorable situation for years, but the city see no need to fix it.  I'd like to know why this type of government neglect is not criminal?  Desert rally car suspension would be put to the test on this road, all the way down to Washington Street.  Guess these residents don't matter....

summary: Americas food basket shopping carts in clock park
description: Shopping carts all over the clock park. Americas food basket not keeping carts on their property

Cars are parked up to and sometime slightly INTO the intersection of Rosemont and Daly Streets. The intersection is dangerous. Pedestrian traffic is often blocked and the automobile sightlines are terrible. There needs to be several "No Parking" signs placed 20' back from the corners, as is the state law, I believe.

When travelling down the left lane on Cambridge Street towards Sturrow, it becomes a left turn ONLY lane at Charles MGH Station.  The center lane is the ONLY lane shown to go straight and the center and right lanes are available for turning right.  This is CLEARLY marked by the huge green traffic sign prior to the station.  Too many times I've been thisclose to getting my car hit by cars that make (mostly) unsignalled, (always) unsafe lane changes.  This especially happens most dangerously when there are cars waiting in the left turn only lane.  The car in the left lane will attempt to go straight OR will attempt to make the right turn to either of the Sturrow Drive onramps.

summary: Allow bicycles on Amtrak trains to and from Boston
description: Please let us bring our bicyles on the train here Amtrak!

The curbcut and part of the path on the inbound side of the Ruggles/Whittier Street intersection along the SW Corridor Bike Path was removed last week and work seems to have been halted, without indication as to when/if it will be replaced, and what detour to take.   For bike commuters, this is equivalent to a line of jersey barriers being strung across the pike or 93.  We are forced to either ride the wrong way into the bus lane to a curb cut about 40' in (the upset busdrivers waiting for their green light "hop and jump" their busses from idle in what I take to be a threat), or ride down to Tremont Street and risk our lives riding a few blocks on that 4 lane highway with motorists who are upset because we are not on the parallel bike path!  This is untenable and would be in the best interest for everyone to be repaired as quickly as possible upon excavation, not left to sit for so long......

Hello.  This small but complex intersection (A two way road becomes a one way road where it meets with a two way road becoming a one way road) has no control--yield, stop, or otherwise.  Though it is a low speed intersection, it causes people turning off of Tremont to come to a stop from confusion, and I've seen where drivers/cyclists coming from Tremont behind another car or more nearly rear end when the car ahead of them behaves unpredictably.

Quick, half-joke but half-serious fix: relocate the stop signs from down Warren Street at Canton.  They are useless, as Canton is one way in opposite directions from Warren.  

One last comment while I have you, why is Warren Ave wide enough for a 5 or 6 lane road?
The button to get the cross signal has been removed from the Laboure Center corner of Broadway and D Street.

This pothole has been there since they put new pipes down.
MY house shacks when trucks go by.
Cement sidewalk near 10 Orlando Street, mattapan electric pole buckling at night hard to see very dangerous
It was dark and I didn't see the pothole as I was walking across the street.  Fell and hurt my knee and wrist.  :(
One of the basketball hoops in the park across the street from the Stonybrook T Station has been broken.

summary: No Parking Here to Corner Signs Needed
description: Entrance to small parking area in rear of H Levenbaum Insurance Agency needs "No Parking Here to Corner" signs on each side.  Cars always hanging out into driveway and obstruct delivery trucks and other traffic.

Anyone who's ever driven down Cambridge Street knows that there will always be at least one car double-parked in the right lane.  Can the city please work on a solution here?

Given that it's right across from the BPD, and there's never a time when there's NOT a double-parked vehicle, maybe requesting enforcement isn't practical.

Maybe the city can remove some of the parking spaces on Cambridge Street to create loading zones?

When delivery vehicles pull flush to the curb at the Pi Alley/City Hall Pedestrian Avenue corner, wheelchairs cannot safely get off the sidewalk.  Signage reminding delivery trucks not to block this ramp would be helpful, we have many wheelchair pedestrians in this area due to the Veterans home.

Please consider making this "official" scooter/motorcycle parking.  There is plenty of egress for pedestrians.  A lot of people already park in this area, but I've had $120 in parking tickets here this summer so I've stopped.  It's a perfectly reasonable area for embracing these environmentally responsible commuter vehicles.
There is an open hole in the sidewalk along Beacon street by the Resevoir across the street from Waterworks--someone could step in @ night--very deep and hard to see............
about 10 inches deep, about 2-3 months old.

There is NO STOPPING in front of the gates at the Harvard Muir/Pool buildings, and yet every day entitled yupsters park in the bike lane, endangering cyclists and also blocking half of this very narrow causeway for motorists in order to drop off their coddled progeny. What makes this doubly ridiculous is the fact that they drive another 50 yards and enter the SECOND gate, at the Stadium, in order to turn around. Please post NO STOPPING, DO NOT BLOCK BIKE LANE signs. This also goes for UPS and FEDEX vehicles. There is no reason why all these vehicles can't go the extra 50 yards and drop off their cargo via the Stadium parking lot.
There is a sink hole which started at just a few inches and is now nearly 1 foot wide and growing.

summary: No Lane Marks on Roadway Bridge
description: There are no lane marks for either north or south bound traffic going over the bridge. Is there a left turn lane? Does one have to be in the right hand lane northbound to proceed over the bridge and into Allston? Or is it all one lane? The southbound lanes are equally unclear.

With the Dean Bridge closed for construction, the volume of traffic coming down Chestnut Hill trying to cross Beacon in the morning rush hour causes very significant backups on Chestnut Hill (all the way to route 9!).  The police officer directing traffic in the morning is critically important, as he/she recognizes the stupidity/inefficiency of the second light here (for the T trains coming out of the yard).  The officer waves cars to pass through no the red, which helps significantly.  But these lights should be reprogrammed to allow for many more cars to pass down Chestnut Hill in the morning.

summary: (pothole)Intersection of Columbus Avenue and Centre Street
description: For years there have been the worst pot holes and submerged utility covers and it has gotten to point of being just dangerous. This intersection needs to be fixed now!!!
There is a crater here that keeps getting bigger and bigger. My car is going to fall in soon.

This whole stretch of Union is one pothole after another.  A positively bone-rattling navigation hazard for anyone delivering kids to the wonderful Tenacity program at the tennis courts.

One year after first reporting it here, the problem is even worse.

As you exit here for Harvard Square, it's not clear if it's a two lane exit or a single lane exit.  Perhaps on purpose?  As you can see in the overhead image, the lane marking diverges slightly to possibly indicate a two lane exit.  Or not?  We don't know.  The lane markings end before we can find out.
Panhandlers frequent this intersection and often walk amidst traffic during rush hour, creating potential for a dangerous accident.

summary: sidewalk was filled with asphalt instead of concrete  - severly crumbled
description: Sidewalk was initially reported about 3 years ago.  At that time, section was filled with asphalt instead of concrete  - has since severely crumbled.

summary: orphaned blue bike locked to bike rack
description: please remove since bike rack space is limited here

The crossing light over Dorchester St is not set properly. It turns to walk and before I am halfway through the crosswalk it starts counting down from 3 and the light turns green as I hit the sidewalk. I am 6'2 and a fast walker. Other crosswalk lights start counting down from 12.

The light at the end of Milk Street crossing with Atlantic Ave. is broken. The light facing Milk is stuck on Red causing huge backups and mass confusiong when the cars on Milk street try to cross the road.
massive pothole in alley 908 near Marlborough entrance

Lady dumps water with chemicals on sidewalk and down drain on Thatcher street, across from Pizzaria Regina.

Typically during the week between 8-9 am.
this street lamp has been out since winter of 2009
Road is very very rough. Terrible just to drive through, can't imagine how unnerving with a funeral procession.
Pothole forming around BWSC water cover. Cars, buses, and trucks fly over it and it shakes the whole building (705 Mass Ave).

summary: Needs to have parking only on one side of the street
description: The block of Berkeley St. needs to only have parking on one side of the street.  Otherwise it goes down to a one lane road and is a bottleneck for traffic coming from the highway and South Boston (traffic consistently backs up and blocks the intersection).
POTHOLSE ON MT. VERNON STREET

my daughter is diagnose with autism...and there was an incident that happened at her school were my daughter had a tamtrum in the class room the school called me so i can go and pick up my daughter when i got there my child was under a table having a episode and the principle from the school told me now that your here im going to take my teachers out of this class room because between you and your child you going to clean up the class room....she took her teachers closed the door and left me there by myself....she knowing that my child have a disability problem and send both of us to clean up.......i reported her......and no one wants to help me everyone has been tossing me around giving me different numbers or they tell me someone will call me back and no one does. And also my childs bus monitor kicked my child off the bus just because she sat on the stairs of the bus the monitor didnt want to do her job so she told my autistic child to get off then the bus left......i also reported that and no one is doing nothing

The green light for traffic heading north goes on early allow people to make a left turn but without warning the green light for oncoming traffic goes on. Its a hazard and very dangerous. Green arrow should be put in so when it turns yellow then red we know that oncoming traffic will begin. 
(At under pass near Santarpios)

summary: Need a "no Parking here to corner" sign
description: On the outbound Beacon Avenue just past Kenmore Square, the two lanes swerve a bit left.  To make matters worse, when cars park at the first parking meter on the right side, the car's tail sticks out into the right lane, effectively pinching the two lanes down to 1.5 lanes.  Even though the car sticks out into the lane, because of the parking meter it appears to be a legal place to park.  This parking meter needs to be removed, and a "No parking here to corner sign" should be installed.
Utica Street appears to be sinking/collapsing creating stagnant noxious water pooling and unsafe sidewalk conditions.

summary: Metal joint in road huge hazard to bikers
description: Today while turning from Massachusetts ave onto Boylston, my front wheel got caught in the metal joint in the road, catapulting me over the bars, breaking my bike, and smashing my helmet.

Potholes galore - Very nasty
Road beyond was fixed, but not this area!

summary: Potholes/patched pavement forces cyclists into roadway
description: Poor pavement on the corner of Beacon Street and Chestnuthill Drive forces bicycles into the road (onto Beacon street) at this very busy and dangerous intersection. All the bikelane driving west on Beacon at this intersection has very dangerous pavement.
Multiple pot holes near the middle of the road going across th ebridge from Boston to Cambridge
Can the city come and pick these up?  They've been thee for over two weeks.

summary: Pothole nearly threw me from my bike!
description: The eastbound lane of this street, specifically in the bike zone, is ground chuck. The potholes are so big that they will unseat a cyclist that doesn't have prior experience with this route. The holes continue all the way to the Cambridge line.

Thinking of catching a glimps of the wind turnbine or IBEW local, FORGET about it, you'd better keep your eye on the road.  Though deceptive and apparently minimal these road hazards really pack a punch.  Watch for incomings side street traffic, many have blind corners!
This st is littered with deep, wide and constant potholes.  Travel at 5 mph is a must if you don't want to a new front end.  A great example of how Fed $ doesn't reach we most needed.
Graffiti

At Mass Ave northbound, at triangular island where traffic coming from expressway turns north onto Mass Ave, a storm drain cover is set with slots parallel to traffic direction and is a hazard to bicycles. Please replace with a bicycle-safe (non-directional) cover or at least turn cover so slots are perpendicular to traffic. Thank you.

Storm drain cover on Mass Ave northbound under railroad bridge near Newmarket is set with slots parallel to traffic and is a hazard to bicycles. Please replace with a bicycle-safe (non-directional) cover or at least set with slots perpendicular to traffic.
Thank you.

The stop light at Granite Avenue for the Neponset Trail pedestrian crossing is very delayed.  After a pedestrian requests the crossing sign by pressing the button, it often takes 2-3 minutes until the light changes.  The long wait prompts pedestrians and cyclists to dash across the street, risking being hit by speeding oncoming traffic.  Then, when the light finally does change, the cars must wait for no one.

The pedestrian crossing light at the Neponset Trail and Granite Avenue should be more responsive.  Traffic should get a red light almost immediately after the crossing request button has been pressed.
test
deep pothole in the intersection of Riverway and Brookline Ave.
Constant speeding on Harvard street....starting at about 4am every truck, car and motorcycle is going nearly twice the limit.

summary: Pothole on 1a offramp at 145 Bennington st.
description: There is an extremely deep pothole on the offramp from Route 1a at Rt 145/east Boston Bennington st. It's been there for at least three weeks.
There are 2 potholes in the right lane, going north.  The AAA repairman said he had to fix 5 flats in one day (yesterday, when we got a flat) in that same stretch of road.  This is a definite hazard.

summary: Pedestrian crossing light rotation - does it ever let pedestrians cross?
description:
I've tried to cross on the northwest side of this intersection many times... Sometimes standing for five minutes or more on the curb. Never seen the lights change to let me across.

Any chance we could get this fixed? It could cut down on the pedestrians constantly running across the road...
Huge pothole in the right lane. Left side of right lane. Been there for 2 weeks.
Two names tagged on wall on the side of the Tire and Supply place. Please paint over!
From Russel to Joy  - it's one giant pot hole.
huge

This stretch of Western Avenue used to have hundreds of unrestricted parking spaces.  Then one day, the BTD removed 95% of them. 

Bike lanes and turning lanes at intersections would be useful.  But a double-wide lane, lined with no stopping signs, doesn't help anyone.  People who live, work, and study in the area should be allowed to have guests visit them by car.  And on-street parking is an important component of a vibrant, walkable community.

The same thing happened on the other side of the business school, on North Harvard Street.

Please restore the on-street parking!

This stretch of North Harvard Street used to have hundreds of unrestricted parking spaces.  Then one day, the BTD removed 95% of them. 

Bike lanes and an appropriate-length left turn lane into the stadium would be useful.  Yellow striped pavement is useless for everyone.  People who live, work, and study in the area should be allowed to have guests visit them by car.  And on-street parking is an important component of a vibrant, walkable community.

The same thing happened on the other side of the business school, on Western Avenue.

Please restore the on-street parking!

summary: Missing sign directing northbound traffic around DTX
description:
There used to be a sign at the corner of Washington and Boylston/Essex, directing northbound traffic on Washington to turn right to continue to Government Center and the Waterfront.  This is important information, since Washington turns into the Downtown Crossing pedestrian mall, and traffic that continues north here is forced back the way it came on Temple Place/Tremont.

This sign has been missing for several years, though its pole is still there.  Please replace the sign!

summary: Poor signage at E end of Longfellow Bridge
description:
The signs for traffic heading east on the Longfellow Bridge are incomplete and confusing.  There should be a sign pointing to the entrance ramp to eastbound Storrow, heading towards 93 and 1.  But the only signs are for Kendall Square and Storrow west.

It's also unclear which side of the T support pillar you're supposed to drive on for which destinations.

This bridge is a late night hangout for the underage hipsters of Allston. The graffiti is rather charming, but the copious amounts of broken glass and bottle-ends is becoming a hazard for children and cyclists. This bridge either needs a debris sweep daily or more security overnight. 
Update: I spoke to a gentleman at MassDot who actually achieved some headway - the bridge is currently clean! If the situation devolves again, please call 617-635-7507 and report it.

summary: Clear the Comm Ave. Bike Lanes!
description: Cars, delivery vehicles, and taxis are constantly blocking the bike lane--from beginning to end--on Comm Ave.  Swerving in and out of traffic is unsafe on any road.

summary: Hazardous dock chained to tree by DCR 6 weeks ago!ires, garbage, bottles,
description: 6-8 weeks ago, after a terrible storm, I called the DCR to let them know that a 60+ foot long concrete dock had broken free of its pilings between the Mass Ave and BU bridges.  How did they respond?  A week or so later they chained it to some trees like you would a dog and haphazardly put up saw horses and caution tape, presumably to keep people away from it.  Old desks, railroad ties and other dangerous debris surround this hazard -- Questions:  How long does it take the DCR to fix or remove a major hazard like this?  What about all of the large and small scale debris infesting the shoreline?  I realize we just experienced some historic flooding, but this is a disgrace!!!
There is a sink hole in the brick sidewalk on Waltham street near approximately 90 Waltham St (Across from Ringgold Park)
Pothole the sixe of two basketballs, lane was closed last night

this property is on the way to roslindale train station.
front yard full of childrens toys and other litter
eye sore to neighborhood

Stop sign needed on Hutchinson where it meets Crosby Street and Old Mystic Street. Very dangerous because drivers coming out of Crosby can't see cars coming from the left from Hutchinson because of the fence around the  corner house.
multiple large potholes behind building near entrance to garage.

trash everywhere on front of yard and in back
on the way to train station make roslindale look like a dump
things on front lawn winter summer all seasons a mess!

Possibly phone lines. There are three wires resting on the roof of the garage behind 44 Hampstead Rd, accessible from Hampstead Lane.

When the wind blows, they abrade (a fourth wire broke several years ago) and there are small children who use the yard they cross -- they can almost reach them overhead with a wiffle bat.

Re-routing entirely would be wonderful, but tightening them up to raise them would be the minimal fix.
An increasingly deep depression around a small manhole cover.
Pothole near the center of the street directly in front of 99 Bynner St.  Almost large enough to fit a basketball in it.

description:
many , many potholes in front of Home Depot, connecting road to 93 north- it is terrible - it is not cared for at all, damaged my wheel 
this part of road is not being serviced for years, will someone follow up on this part of road- high traffic area start @ Schrafts all the way to 93 entrance
pot hole @ Chelsea and 5th

Pothole at intersection of Bennington and Leverett Street. Bad area as you need to move over sensors to get light to turn green.  Sensors located in midst of a field of potholes and has caused one flat tire since Winter.  Plows worsen situation by digging up larger chunks of roadway when they passed during storms.

Several Potholes along Palermo Street some small and easy to navigate around, some crater sized that the only answer is to drive directly into and hope you come out ok.  I have had 2 flat tires since last fall from potholes on this street.
The whole Back Street looks like the Grand Canyon. I've already ruined my tires here.
on the left lane of the exit ramp
This is a doozy, right on the exit ramp from I90 to East Boston.  It's in the left lane.
A huge pothole, about 2.5ft long, 1.5ft wide, and 1 ft deep, is in the middle of the street next to the MFA.
Couldn't see this monster because it was filled with rain.  Two tires and a bent rim later....

description: Dozens of bad potholes line Summer Street heading into South Boston, between the channel bridge and E 1st St.  Cars take a pounding.
The entire road is a mess.
This entire road is a mess. I don't use it anymore and have to go around because it will destroy my car
This section right after the Blue hill/ Morton intersection is horrible! Both sides of this road needs to be seriously fixed.
This section of Morton St for the most part was always smooth. Now there's no avoiding these crater like potholes (on both directions). Be extremely careful on the side heading towards Aborway!
Huge pothole right in the center of the intersection!
Large Pothole in the middle of the street.
pot hole on the right as you turn onto longfellow bridge from Storrow drive off ramp
Pothole as you  right turn onto the salt & pepper bridge (Longfellow) from Storrow drive.
Big pothole, maybe 1 foot long or longer.  Looked like a swimming pool this morning
Most of Walnut Avenue, Roxbury is a mess!

Huge area, about 4 x 5 feet with a 4" depression. This is on top of the "bridge" that goes over the D line between Minor St. and Fullerton St.  No way to swerve around this unless into oncoming traffic or running over a pedestrian or cyclist.
big pothole - probably 8 inches deep in left lane
Middle lane, right side. Not good with cars going at high speed!
On Glocester street between the comm ave mall area.  As you are making a left onto comm ave and headed to the Public Garden there is a large hole.
On hereford street between becon and back street.  Right next to the school for opthomology.  Roads are damaged.
this alley is full of potholes - desperately needs help!  multiple slalom-like formations make it impossible to drive down to parking.
Left lane at merge from underpass, a deep pothole on passenger side of vehicle.

There's a series of potholes in the right lane just as you drive around this rotary with the entrance to the Aboretum on your right.   They are scattered through virtually the entire width of the lane.
numerous pothole all down road
2 potholes on Lincoln & Summer St
Big pothole, left lane going Eastbound, right near downtown boston exit
Pierre's car got @#$% UP the other day on this pothole
I saw a pothole here Saturday... sorry no picture.
There is an entire patch of potholes about 15 ft x 15 ft and when making a sharp right turn on Farmington it is impossible not to hit them. Please repave!

summary: Pothole in middle of one-way street
description: There is a pothole in the middle of Glendower Rd. in Roslindale. It is in the middle of the street around 90-100 or 101-110. Thank you.

summary: cars speeding up and down street
description: cars, trucks, all kinds of vehicles use Castleton as a cut through between Jamaicaway and S. Huntington; vehicles drive up and down the street at and above 40 mph, including police cars without lights or sirens.  lots of kids and pets in the neighborhood, not sure how someone hasn't been hit yet.

summary: Multiple potholes in middle lane under RR over pass

description:
Must be at least 5 feet long.  Plastic barrel standing of the road.  

Just looks like a puddle today since it is filled with water.
Large pothole between Back St and the storrow drive exit for kenmore
Cars frequently turning right onto Storrow Dr. from the left, straight/left-turn only lane.  Happens very, very frequently, endangering cyclists and vehicles proceeding over the Longfellow bridge.

This pothole is in the left lane on this stretch of 203 coming into JP.   With all the rain  yesterday I did not see it coming and it completely busted the seam of my front left tire.  Very dangerous.
This cobble stone street is full of enormous potholes with entire stones missing, paved over areas that are now falling apart, and in general needs to be fixed.  Ridiculous.

The left lane of this entire stretch of road from the Hill to Morton is loaded with 4-6inch need holes with sharp edges.  With a tight roadway and high sharp media curbs this road way will do definately cause alignment damage and dangerous travel.  Bad weather is that much worse.  Find alternate route if you value your life & car.

These traffic lights are disregarded by motorists at all hours of the day. MBTA Route 66 busses do not stop at this red light at all. The left arrow directing traffic on to Harvard Ave. is entirely useless, since people will turn left during any light circumstance. A police patrol is needed at this intersection at all times until a better solution can be found.
Several street lights and a red fire lamp are burnt out near Armington St and Islington St.
This is the worst hole in boston. It starts off as a huge bump then it just falls. its really bad and needs to be fixed. its been there for atleast 5 years

Going westbound at this intersection of N. Arsenal Street, the traffic light has four signals, the 4th being a green arrow (to turn left onto Soldiers Field Road).  The green arrow light has been out for months (possibly a year!).  It's very dangerous taking a left turn here because the oncoming traffic on N. Arsenal has a delayed light while you are allowed to make a turn (the green arrow should be lit for a few seconds before their light turns green on the other side of the road.)

On 1A after Curtis Street but before Bremen Street Park in Right Hand Lane. I got a flat tire and my car needs to be aligned. A few weeks ago I saw two other vehicles that had flats in the same location. Watch out!

On 1A after Curtis Street  but before Bremen Street Park in Right Hand Lane.  I got a flat tire and my car needs to be aligned.  A few weeks ago I saw two other vehicles that had flats in the same location.  Watch out!

I dodge this pothole every morning. I drive up Dalton Street every morning and take a left at the firehouse. And right in front of Dhillon's and just in front of the center barriers, there are two poles that will wake me up if I drive over them.
i hit this pothole soooo far. i just bought my car from herb chambers and was hopping to get onto the pike and i hit this pothole right at the base of the ramp in the right hand lane.
Right hand lane before the toll at Exit 18 on I-90 westbound.

Boylston, from Tremont to Washington is THE roughest stretch of asphalt in the city.  IIf you travel more than 5mph you will damage your car.  

This is a perfect place to "off road" in your new 4wd SUV without leaving the city!  LOL

There is a sidewalk along beacon street at the southern tip of the chestnut hill reservoir that is not cleared.  In the past few years I do not recall it ever being cleared of snow and ice during the winter months. Not sure who the property owner is, but it would be nice to remind them to shovel their walks.
Pothole in the intersection of Medford and Terminal st.

POTHOLE CITY! This bridge connecting Terminal St. with Chelsea St going underneath the Tobin Bridge in Charlestown is the worst section of road in the city. At least 50+ basketball sized potholes in a 50 yard stretch of bridge. A rear tire fell victim earliest this year when a bolt that must've fallen from the bridge landed in a pothole and punctured the inner-sidewall of the tire when driving over it causing tire, rim, and brake damage.

summary: Sign fell 2+ years ago, never replaced
description: Large sign indicating the exit ahead (Harvard Square) fell down in a storm over two years ago.  It has never been replaced.  The posts are still standing with nothing on them.  There is lots of traffic to this exit by out-of-towners who are visiting Harvard and the general area, and there has not been a sign directing them to this exit for quite some time.

summary: Green Light out at Guest/Market st Intersection.
Crosswalks missing from dangerous intersections on Harrison Ave.
description:
There is a a dangerous lack of crosswalks between E. Berkeley and W. Dedham Streets on Harrison Avenue in Boston's South End.

There are only two crosswalk (at Thayer and Randolph Streets) along those five busy blocks.  There are no crosswalks at Fay Street or Perry Street or Savoy Street or Rollins Street, putting pedestrians at great danger.

It’s a tragedy waiting to happen in this increasingly residential and commercial neighborhood.

The attached crosswalk map has been shared with the City of Boston in hopes that additional crosswalks will be added, especially near the "Power Station" near Savoy, home to many public events and fairs.

(Update:  the city installed a crosswalk at the intersection of Harrison & Randolph in late 2010, which is wonderful.  But more were promised and are needed at various additional intersections along this stretch.)

On the access road to Soldiers Field Road/Storrow Drive eastbound, between Western & River, near the entrance to the Mass Pike, the lane markings for the right-most two lanes have worn off.  All other lane markings are present and visible.  This has led some drivers to not realize that it's a two-lane area; they presume there's only one lane available.
PotHole located on the turn from St. Alphonsus St. onto Longwood Ave.  To avoid you must cross lane into oncoming traffic.  makes an issue for traffic in both directions.

Potholes outside Presentation nursing home, 10 Bellamy St. in Brighton.

The elderly and disabled patients with wheelchairs, walkers, and canes use this dangerous street as there is no sidewalk . Ambulances, LifeLine, Ride vehicles are severely jolted as they cross the area.
Problem

summary: Damaged sidewalks at the BB station
description: Who is responsible for the deplorable and unsafe conditions of the  sidewalks at the Back Bay MBTA station? This is a major station for residents, visitors and tourists and certainly does not reflect well on our city.

summary: New Sign a DANGER to PEDESTRIANS
description: New signage installed at eye level has injured several passersby who are trying to negotiate the curb and uneven bricks.  The sign should be raised or moved.  Someone could end up losing an eye from this sign.

summary: This section of the street is AWEFUL
description:
rapid fire potholes... the street is swiss cheese.  

Each time I ride my bike down this road, my chain jumps off my bike.
This street is incredibly dark and unsafe at night.  There is not a single streetlight on the western side of the street.

summary: Low Sign on Corner a danger to pedestrians
description: Newly installed sign on corner is at eye level and has injured many pedestrians:  eye injury, forehead injury, cheek injury.  SIgn needs to either be raised or removed.
Uneven street, several holes
A couple of them lie right before and right after this intersection
In the middle of the road which are getting worse. May have something to do with the building being built on the street shifting the ground a bit may be

summary: (pothole) ENORMOUS Thank you Residents who paid for the repavement
description:
Thank you to six building owners who, after one year of requesting the City of Boston's help and received none (not one penny of our 39% increase in tax dollars!!!), paid out of their pockets to repave portions of this alley. Here again proving that private citizens, not city government, do the right thing with out money.  Boston, you should be ashamed of yourselves for taking more money and giving less.  Ashamed!

Poorly repaired and 5 new potholes of similar size and depth riddle this alleyway.  3 FOOT X 1 FOOT pothole on Back Street between Hereford and Mass Ave along with huge depressions from the Boston's oversized garbage trucks bearing down and scarring this alley.  It is dangerous condition and has taken dozens of tires, rims, bumpers, bikers and small children.  Why is the only stretch of Back Street that has not been repaired and repaved???  Please HELP!!!
THERE IS A HUGE POTHOLE OUTSIDE MY HOUSE SDLFKHJDSLKFJDSLKFJLDS MY CAR IS ON FIRE
Just as you come off 93, heading towards the connector heading for storrow (exit 26 on 93), there are 2 potholes at the exanpsion joints in the middle of the lane. DANGEROUS FOR MOTORCYCLISTS.

Someone, a private business truck or the DPW Trash truck leaks large amounts of oil. 
When this truck is parked in front of DDonuts and because the gutter slopes down tilting the truck, it leaks vast amount s of oil into the gutter, literally puddling, then draining down into the drainage system.  People walk and slip through it.  Very dangerous and nasty.  Recenty the sidewalks were replaced and the oil leaking has not happened for a few weeks, but keep an eye on this area.

Between 175 and 176 Federal Street, outside of Peet's Coffee there are numerous black bricks that are loose and very wobbly creating a dangerous situation.  This is a city DPW section of sidewalk , not the responsibility of 176 or 175 Federal Street office buildings.
Anderson Street from Cambridge Street to Myrtle Street has numerous little potholes that are slowly becoming one long pothole the length of the street.

summary: No Access to Bike Path from Bridge
description:
When heading south on the Mass Ave bridge on a bicycle, and using the bicycle lane, there is no way to get to the bike path along the river.

The solution here would be to build a ramp on this side of the bridge down to the river.

This would be safer for bikers, and prevent the temptation to ride on the opposite sidewalf (unsafe for pedestrians) in order to use that ramp.
Just a mash of bad holes and pot holes on Forsyth street starting from Hemenway and all the way to where Ruggles Station is

horrible pot hole on comm ave before Fairfield i nthe left lane headed towards Fenway. Is deceiving & seems to be growing in length. Wiped out bad on this one!

could the city mark the left lane off Washington street onto Ukraine Way as Left Turn Only?
Large holes constantly damaging vehicles.  They keep putting a temporary fix which lasts about a week.  TAKE CARE OF THIS CITY!!

It is extremely difficult for cyclists to negotiate the intersection of N. Beacon, Soldier's Field Road, and Nonantum, in particular for cyclists traveling from N. Beacon or Parsons Street, traveling westbound. There are no paths, and cyclists are forced to merge with cars that are usually both speeding, and attempting to cross multiple lanes. At the least, a speed limit should be imposed, or a lane painted to aid cyclists establish their right of way. As it is, when traveling in a vehicle lane, I am regularly assaulted and menaced by drivers.
Vehicle security gate for Federal Reserve has buzzer that is too high decibel level. Hearing damage for pedestrians. Popular route for families visiting Children's Museum.
very deep hole cant be seen at night. it is said it is bottomless and goes to china

The bike lane and road next to the curb on the southbound side of Massachusetts Avenue here is full of potholes and uneven pavement. Its actually pretty dangerous to ride a bicycle over. The whole corner from the beginning of the #1 MBTA Bus stop to the edge of Beacon St needs to be repaved. This is of concern because many cyclists ride through this patch of road every day coming off of the Harvard Bridge.
Pothole located right at the lights in the left  most lane for the cars taking a left  turn.

summary: Crosswalk request signal at bikepath doesn't work
description: At the intersection of the bike path with Ruggles Street, the button that requests a walk signal across Ruggles is broken--- you can push it forever and the light never changes. It's not clear how cyclists are supposed to get across other than by just watching really carefully, or by waiting until the light turns green for the buses and then running out in front of a bus. Which... isn't really a safe option.
This one is right befor teh stop sign on the on ramp to the J-way.  Most of the time you can stradle it, But at night it's a shot in the dark.

several small potholes appeared this winter at the intersection of pratt and wadsworth. it is very annoying to avoid them every day on my bike.

Driving east on Comm Ave just past the Charlesgate overpass there are a series of potholes that don't seem to have been fixed ever.  They have gotten progressively worse in the last month and I'm afraid one of these days it will pop a tire or I'm going to run into another car while trying to avoid the mess.

This is a major turning point for tanker trucks coming from the East Boston Oil storage facilities - and they even have trouble with the size and frequency of the potholes.

Be careful taking a left from Soldier's Field onto Western as it can be hard to spot. It's slightly more visible if you're coming from Cambridge on Western crossing the bridge. This has been here for months.

There are multiple potholes on the stretch of North Harvard between Western Ave and Soldier's Field Road. Expect to find bicycle riders frantically avoiding these flat-makers and the cars jutting out from the parking lots. It's also narrow with cars parked on both sides, and is used by various buses, which makes dodging these potholes tricky at times.

Three years ago these holes took out my catalytic converter, the year before it cracked an axle.

This sewer lid has about a 2-foot ring of pot-hole around it - stay to the right.

summary: (pothole) Crossing Causeway to go over Charlestown Bridge
description: If you are in the left lane

This bad pothole has been there for a long time, at least 1 1/2 years (or it keeps reopening when they fix it) If you are on Atlantic Ave and take a right onto Summer Street at South Station, you can't miss it. It's as wide as a lane! I've gotten a flat here before.
Has been there on and off for 8 months.  Gets repaired every 2 months or so.  Middle of left lane.  4" deep.

Watch out fotr this one. It's on a blind corner.
There is a big pot hole right in front of the Globe,  the road is dimly lit there and I've hit it several times this week...

Pothole in left lane of eastbound Commonwealth Avenue just after the dip under the Mass Ave underpass.  This one was at least a foot deep two weeks ago.  They poured some asphalt into it but it has formed again.  Use the right lane if you like having your steering aligned and your rims round.
Day Boulevard is a minefield since the construction and gets worse every day because of the weather..

I think these two are due to the weather and have recently appeared. You can't really avoid them either. If you try to avoid one, you'll hit the other... or an on coming car, might I add, one that is probably speeding.
in the middle line

3 huge ones right as you come out of the overpass that dumps you onto Storrow Drive. I called the state about these in March of 08 and again sometime during the early summer, still haven't been fixed.

I don't drive in the city very often, but I take the T at this stop every day, and there are two potholes alongside the stop that fill up with water whenever there's precipitation. Guess what happens whenever someone drives over them... I don't like going to work covered in muddy water.

summary: (pothole) This is definetly the gateway to @#$%
description: Several potholes when on charlesgate trying to get on Storrow Drive. Every time I drive down this road. Which is ever fricken day I swear I can hear Satan himself laughing as I swerve to avoid being swallowed up into what must be purgatory. It is so bad I often hold onto rosary beads as I drive around here. Amen. ps...one time i swear i saw a person peak their head out of one of these bad boys, must be pretty deep. I think people live in some of these pot holes. So they dudes that patch them up..scream.."is anyone down there" before you pile on more asphalt.

summary: (pothole) Comm Ave, South Street to Lake Street
description: Went to a BC basketball game last night, I had forgotten how bad this road is. I can't say it's one pothole in particular; rather, the entire stretch from South Street to Lake Street is akin to one giant pothole. I've been on smoother dirt roads.

Something is seriously wrong with the roadway and/or the expansion joints on this overpass and the city should make it a priority to fix it.  It's like driving over 15 jolting drops no matter what side you're driving on and it's only gotten worse this winter, no doubt because the road needs to be plowed.  If the traffic isn't bad, take the extra time to stay below and avoid this overpass.  Your suspension will thank you.
In the middle lane of Storrow Drive Westbound, there are manholes which seemed to have sunk and really rattle your car. Miserable and hard to avoid!
Beware of random bricks in the road at this location.
Right as you turn on Longwood Av.

summary: (pothole) Mass Pike right lane eastbound just before Allston tolls
description: This pothole is around a grate, and ate the front end of my car on the way to the airport recently. It is still there. It's on the downhill slope right before the tolls.

It looks like a road crew dug up what was a frost heave only to leave a 4 inch deep, 2 foot square hole. The cone put there to designate where the hole is has been crushed by hundreds of cars and now lies in pieces in the middle of the road, an eerie omen to what is slowly happening to our cars.

Been swerving left to avoid this pothole for months... looks like I will continue to swerve left to avoid this pothole for months to come.
